title: Diango's Workshop

properties.name: description
properties.value: Diango's Workshop is an underground factory in Draynor Village whose entrance is found in the north-westernmost house in Draynor Village.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Diango's Workshop
Diango's Workshop
Released24 October 2013 (Update)
MembersNo
LocationDraynor Village
Music• High Spirits
• Diango's Little Helpers
Map
Advanced data
Typebuilding

Diango's Workshop is an underground factory in Draynor Village whose entrance is found in the north-westernmost house in Draynor Village.

It is used for holiday events, and has so far been used in the 2013 Halloween event, 2014 Christmas event and the 2017 Christmas event.

Contents

  • 1 General appearance
  • 2 Halloween 2013
  • 3 Christmas 2014
    • 3.1 Baubles
    • 3.2 Marionettes
  • 4 Christmas 2017

General appearance[edit | edit source]

The entrance to Diango's Workshop.

The workshop has two floors and a small third floor that was used in the Halloween event. The upper two floors have yellow floors, brick walls, and paint splattered around. The northern portion of the top floor of the workshop has three tables arranged with paint. The southern portion of the upper floor had boxes. There was a long bridge spanning the place from north to south, and side areas.

On the lower floor were several long tables. The lower floor was only accessible for the Halloween event, and was a small alcove under the Haunted Tree.

Halloween 2013[edit | edit source]

Main article: 2013 Halloween event

The Workshop looked worse for this appearance. The lighting was slightly worse than during Christmas, and the central bridge had been destroyed about halfway along it by the Haunted Tree. The lower level's tables were absent, and the tree, with two faces and two roots, stood in the centre. Players could yank the roots and enter the small basement, where they could hack away tree roots from below it.

Christmas 2014[edit | edit source]

Main article: 2014 Christmas event

In Christmas of 2014, Diango opened up the workshop after his Pixies repeatedly failed to create the toys correctly. The workshop was populated by seven pixies, Rosie, Cait, Sorcha, Donnacha, Ronan, Fionn and Cormac. There were many tasks that the pixies needed completed.

Baubles[edit | edit source]

Baubles were found in the southern portion of Diango's Workshop. Inside the workshop, the player went to the northern tables, where they could paint them. The player then could either put them in boxes and give them to the bearded stranger at the members gate to Taverley, or put them on the Christmas Tree in Varrock, that replaced the fountain.

Marionettes[edit | edit source]

The player could also go downstairs to the wide tables and create a marionette by assembling the various parts. The marionettes were then placed in a box and delivered to the bearded stranger at the members gate to Taverley.

Christmas 2017[edit | edit source]

Main article: 2017 Christmas event

In Christmas of 2017, players entered the workshop after convincing the pixies to return to work after their strike. Players spoke to Donnacha the Foreman to fill their empty sack for the Wise Old Man, who is filling in for Santa.

{{*}} [[Diango's Little Helpers]] |map = {{Map|name=Diango's Workshop|x=3091|y=3275|mtype=square|zoom=3|r=5}} |type = building }} '''Diango's Workshop''' is an underground factory in [[Draynor Village]] whose entrance is found in the north-westernmost house in [[Draynor Village]]. It is used for [[holiday events]], and has so far been used in the [[2013 Halloween event]], [[2014 Christmas event]] and the [[2017 Christmas event]]. ==General appearance== [[File:Diangos Workshop entrance.png|thumb|250px|The entrance to Diango's Workshop.|left]] The workshop has two floors and a small third floor that was used in the Halloween event. The upper two floors have yellow floors, brick walls, and paint splattered around. The northern portion of the top floor of the workshop has three tables arranged with paint. The southern portion of the upper floor had boxes. There was a long bridge spanning the place from north to south, and side areas. On the lower floor were several long tables. The lower floor was only accessible for the Halloween event, and was a small alcove under the Haunted Tree. ==Halloween 2013== [[File:Chopping evil roots.png|thumb|250px|left]] {{Main|2013 Halloween event}} The Workshop looked worse for this appearance. The lighting was slightly worse than during Christmas, and the central bridge had been destroyed about halfway along it by the Haunted Tree. The lower level's tables were absent, and the tree, with two faces and two roots, stood in the centre. Players could yank the roots and enter the small basement, where they could hack away tree roots from below it. ==Christmas 2014== [[File:2014 Christmas event - Diango's Workshop.png|thumb|250px|left]] {{Main|2014 Christmas event}} In Christmas of 2014, [[Diango]] opened up the workshop after his Pixies repeatedly failed to create the toys correctly. The workshop was populated by seven pixies, [[Rosie (pixie)|Rosie]], [[Cait]], [[Sorcha]], [[Donnacha]], [[Ronan]], [[Fionn]] and [[Cormac]]. There were many tasks that the pixies needed completed. ===Baubles=== Baubles were found in the southern portion of Diango's Workshop. Inside the workshop, the player went to the northern tables, where they could paint them. The player then could either put them in boxes and give them to the [[bearded stranger]] at the members gate to [[Taverley]], or put them on the Christmas Tree in Varrock, that replaced the fountain. ===Marionettes=== The player could also go downstairs to the wide tables and create a [[marionette]] by assembling the various parts. The marionettes were then placed in a box and delivered to the [[bearded stranger]] at the members gate to Taverley. ==Christmas 2017== {{Main|2017 Christmas event}} In Christmas of 2017, players entered the workshop after convincing the pixies to return to work after their strike. Players spoke to [[Donnacha]] the Foreman to fill their [[Empty sack (Christmas 2017)|empty sack]] for the [[Wise Old Man]], who is filling in for [[Santa]]. {{Draynor Village}} {{2013 Halloween event}} {{2014 Christmas event}} {{2017 Christmas event}}
